005.json.src: 詳しいことは、問合せ先に聞いてください。

errors.text: Please ask the contact person for details.

errors.text: Child Rearing

005.json.src: 離婚、未婚、死亡などの ため１人で18歳以下のお子さんを育てている場合に支給されます。
005.json.mt: It is paid when you are raising a child who is 18 years old or younger by yourself because of divorce, being unmarried, or death.

errors.text: It is paid when you are raising a child who is 18 years old or younger

005.json.src: ※お父さんまたはお母さんが一定の障害の状態にある場合を含みます。
005.json.mt: * Including cases where the father or mother is in a certain state of disability.

errors.text: Including cases where

005.json.src: ※お子さんが18歳の場合、誕生日～3月31日までは対象になります。
005.json.mt: * If your child is 18 years old, he is eligible from his birthday to March 31st.

errors.text: If your child is 18 years old, he is eligible from his birthday to March 31st.

005.json.src: 遺族基礎年金
005.json.mt: Survivors' basic pension

005.json.src: 国民年金加入者や老齢基礎年金に25年以上加入していた方が死亡し、その配偶者が18歳以下のお子さんと一緒に暮らしている場合などに支給されます。
005.json.mt: It is paid when a national pension policyholder or a person who has been a member of the old-age basic pension for more than 25 years dies and his or her spouse lives with a child under 18 years old.

errors.text: It is paid when a national pension policyholder or a person who has been a member of the old-age basic pension for more than 25 years dies and his or her spouse lives with a child under 18 years old.

005.json.src: ※お子さんが18歳の場合、誕生日～3月31日までは対象になります。
005.json.mt: * If your child is 18 years old, he is eligible from his birthday to March 31st.

errors.text: If your child is 18 years old, he is eligible from his birthday to March 31st.

005.json.src: 税の減免をうける

errors.text: To receive tax relief

005.json.src: 税法上の条件に該当する方は、税金が軽くなる制度の適用を受けることができます。
005.json.mt: If you meet the conditions under the tax law, you can apply for the system reduction system.

errors.text: If you meet the conditions under the tax law, you can apply for the system reduction system.

005.json.src: また、条件に該当する方は、住民税（市・県民税）が非課税となったり、減免される場合があります。
005.json.mt: In addition, those who meet the conditions may be exempt from or exempt from resident tax (municipal and prefectural inhabitants tax).

errors.text: In addition, those who meet the conditions may be exempt from or exempt from resident tax (municipal and prefectural inhabitants tax).

005.json.src: 適用を受けようとする場合は、年末調整や確定申告で忘れずに申告をしてください。
005.json.mt: If you want to apply for it, please don't forget to file it at the year-end adjustment or Final Income Tax Return.

errors.text: If you want to apply for it, please don't forget to file it at the year-end adjustment or Final Income Tax Return.

005.json.src: 保護者の病気など社会的な理由により一時的に家庭での子育てが難しい場合に、原則、一週間を限度に、乳児院・児童養護施設・里親宅でお子さんを預かります。
005.json.mt: In cases where it is temporarily difficult to raise children at home due to social reasons such as the guardian's illness, the child will be taken care of in an infant home, foster home or foster home for up to one week in principle.

005.json.mt: For single-parent families and widows who are having trouble with their daily lives.

005.json.src: 多様な保育
005.json.mt: Diverse child care

005.json.src: 保護者の仕事などの理由でお子さんの保育が必要な場合、保育所などが利用できます。
005.json.mt: If you need to take care of your child for reasons such as a guardian's job, you can use a day-care center.

errors.text: If you need to take care of your child for reasons such as a guardian's job, you can use a day-care center.

005.json.src: 休日保育や延長保育、夜間保育、病児保育、病児後保育などもあります。
005.json.mt: There are also Holiday Day Care, Extended Child Care, Night Child Care, Day Care for Sick Children and Day Care after Sick Children.

errors.text: There are also Holiday Day Care, Extended Child Care, Night Child Care, Day Care for Sick Children and Day Care after Sick Children.

005.json.src: 幼稚園における預かり保育
005.json.mt: After-hours childcare at kindergartens

005.json.src: 通っている幼稚園または認定こども園において一時預かり保育を行います。
005.json.mt: Temporary Child Care is provided at the kindergarten or the center for early childhood education and care.

errors.text: Temporary Child Care is provided at the kindergarten or the center for early childhood education and care.

005.json.src: 問合せ先：各幼稚園　認定こども園
005.json.mt: Contact: Center for Early Childhood Education and Care

errors.text: Contact
Center for Early Childhood Education and Care

005.json.src: 一時預かり
005.json.mt: Temporary custody

errors.text: Temporary custody

005.json.src: 急に発生した事情などにより、一時的に家庭での保育が難しくなる場合や、育児疲れによる保護者の心や身体の負担を減らすため、お子さんを一時的に預かります。
005.json.mt: We take care of children temporarily in order to reduce the burden on parents' mind and body due to childcare fatigue or when it becomes temporarily difficult to take care of children at home due to sudden circumstances.

errors.text: We take care of children temporarily in order to reduce the burden on parents' mind and body due to childcare fatigue or when it becomes temporarily difficult to take care of children at home due to sudden circumstances.

005.json.mt: School expense assistance, etc.

005.json.src: お子さんが通っている学校の種類に応じて、就学のための費用などが援助されます。
005.json.mt: Depending on the type of school your child goes to, expenses for attending school and so on are supported.

errors.text: Depending on the type of school your child goes to, expenses for attending school and so on are supported.

005.json.src: 奨学金等（日本学生支援機構）
005.json.mt: Scholarships (Japan Student Services Organization)

005.json.src: 大学・短期大学などに通う方に対する給付型奨学金や授業料減免等があります。
005.json.mt: There are grant-type scholarships and tuition reduction and exemption for those who attend universities and junior colleges.

errors.text: There are grant-type scholarships and tuition reduction and exemption for those who attend universities and junior colleges.

005.json.src: 子どもの学びや社会体験の機会を確保する
005.json.mt: Ensuring opportunities for children to learn and experience society

005.json.src: 中学生の学習支援
005.json.mt: Learning support for junior high school students

005.json.src: 学習習慣を身に付けることや高校進学などを目指して、一人ひとりの学習レベルに合わせた学習会を開催しています。
005.json.mt: Learning sessions are held according to each student's level of learning, with the aim of acquiring learning habits and advancing to high school.

Planning Office for the Future of Children, Department of Children and Youth
TEL

005.json.src: ひとり親家庭の子どもの居場所づくり
005.json.mt: Creating spaces for children in single-parent families

005.json.src: 小学５年生から中学３年生までのお子さんを対象に、気軽に立ち寄り、おしゃべりをしたり宿題をしたり、ゆっくり過ごしたりイベントに参加することができる場を設けています
005.json.mt: For children from the 5th grade of elementary school to the 3rd grade of junior high school, we have a place where they can casually drop in, chat, do their homework, relax and participate in events.

errors.text: For children from the 5th grade of elementary school to the 3rd grade of junior high school, we have a place where they can casually drop in, chat, do their homework, relax and participate in events.

Planning Office for the Future of Children, Department of Children and Youth

005.json.src: 文化・スポーツ交流
005.json.mt: Cultural and sports exchanges

005.json.src: 「親と子」「ひとり親同士」の交流や、将来の職業選択のきっかけとなるよう、スポーツや音楽などプロの世界を体験できるイベントを開催しています。
005.json.mt: We hold events where parents and children and single parents can interact with each other and experience the professional world of sports and music to help them make career choices in the future.

errors.text: We hold events where parents and children and single parents can interact with each other and experience the professional world of sports and music to help them make career choices in the future.

005.json.src: ひとり親家庭休養ホーム
005.json.mt: Leisure Facilities for Single-Parent Households

005.json.src: 「国民宿舎奥浜名湖」などの宿泊施設や「レゴランド」などの日帰り施設を利用する場合、料金が補助されます。
005.json.mt: If you use accommodation such as "Kokumin Shukusha Okuhamanako" "or day trip facilities such as" "Legoland" ", you will be subsidized."

005.json.src: 市有施設優待利用
005.json.mt: Preferential use of municipal facilities

005.json.src: 東山動植物園や市科学館など市の施設が、無料で利用できます。
005.json.mt: You can use the city facilities such as Higashiyama Zoo and Botanical Gardens and the city science museum for free.
